pButton.Name: QUADRIVIUM
pButton.popInfo: Also known as the numerate arts, it included arithmetic, geometry, astronomy, and music.

pButton.Name: TRIVIUM
pButton.popInfo: Also referred to as the language arts, this consisted of rhetoric (speaking with eloquence), grammar (the mechanics of the Latin language), and dialectic (the logic of argument).

pButton.Name: THEOLOGY
pButton.popInfo: The study of religious faith, it was regarded as the queen of all disciplines and all fields of inquiry.

pButton.Name: PETER ABELARD
pButton.popInfo: One of the first great minds to emerge, he was recognized as professor by his fellow students. He is now regarded as the Great Knight of the Dialectic.

pButton.Name: THOMAS AQUINAS
pButton.popInfo: Aquinas was initially called “the dumb ox” by professors at the University of Paris because he was so quiet. No ox, he authored one of the great masterpieces of all times, <font face='lc-Italic'>Summa Theologica</font>, which set out to prove the existence of God through the use of science.
